title: (x) "Autosport" Type ID and Suggestions - various {gang}
content:
Hi guys and gals,   
   
   
Im working on some design work - I'm look for some "retro" (hate that word) motoring "typefaces" from the 60s and 70s...   
   
   
 ![Autosport](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143341im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/35076.jpg)   
   
   
For instance this Autosport type for a start - and any other suggestions of 60s and 70s type that looks "motoring" like - in particular motorsport-esque...   
   
   
   
James
author: jcarruthers

comments.content:
I'd say more British really - it's hopefully for use with a Triumph garage/parts place... which is british and based in England - so I guess it's logical and suitable to use a British looking type.   
   
   
   
James

You could take a look at the House Industries Chalet families, especially Chalet Comprime.   
   
 [http://houseind.com/house.php?kit=COMPRIME-FO](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143341/http:/houseind.com/house.php?kit=COMPRIME-FO)   
   
Definitely European in origin, if not specifically British, and giving a nod to the mod.

Cheers people!   
   
TR4A is my fave TR...!   
   
This is my beauty though...   
   
 ![My Spitfire Mk3 - Front](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143341im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/35082.jpg)   
 ![My Spitfire Mk3 - Back](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143341im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/35083.jpg)

That Triumph logo looks a bit like Radiant.   
(which I just took for a test drive at Myfonts :-)   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/radiant-ef/radiant-text-demi-bold/testdrive.html?s=TRIUMPH&p=72](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143341/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/radiant-ef/radiant-text-demi-bold/testdrive.html?s=TRIUMPH&p=72)

For Autosport, FB's [Garage Gothic Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143341/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/garage-gothic/garagegothic-bold/testdrive.html?s=AUTOSPORT&p=72) comes close but was created long after the sample you posted. Another suggestion may be [Placard Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143341/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/placard-mt/condensed/testdrive.html?s=AUTOSPORT&p=72)

Check out Block Gothic from Red Rooster.   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/block-gothic-rr/medium-condensed/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143341/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/block-gothic-rr/medium-condensed/)

Thanks everyone for their suggestions! Most useful!   
   
   
   
James
